info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 4:59PM EDT until August 18 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Newport News, James City and York.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, Grove, Lee Hall, Busch Gardens, Carver Gardens, York Terrace, U.s. Naval Weapons, Lackey, Water Country U.S.A., Newport News Golf Course and Yorktown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: James City, VA; York, VA; City of Newport News, VA
